when_to_say: Used to refer to a large plant with a trunk and branches.
example: الشجرة في الحديقة جميلة. (al-shajra fi al-hadiqa jameela.) - The tree in the garden is beautiful.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a blooming part of a plant.
example: الزهرة لونه رائع. (al-zahra lawnuhu raa'i.) - The flower has a wonderful color.

when_to_say: Used to refer to water droplets falling from the sky.
example: المطر ينزل بكثرة اليوم. (al-matar yanzil bikathra al-yawm.) - The rain is falling heavily today.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the star that provides light and heat to the earth.
example: الشمس ساطعة اليوم. (al-shams saati'a al-yawm.) - The sun is shining today.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the natural satellite of the Earth.
example: القمر في السماء لامع. (al-qamar fi al-sama' laami'a.) - The moon is shining in the sky.

when_to_say: Used to refer to a luminous point in the night sky.
example: هناك العديد من النجوم في السماء. (hunaka al-adeed min al-nujoom fi al-sama'.) - There are many stars in the sky.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the expanse above the earth.
example: السماء زرقاء اليوم. (al-sama' zarqaa' al-yawm.) - The sky is blue today.

when_to_say: Used to refer to the solid surface of the earth.
example: الأرض مغطاة بالثلوج. (al-ard maghtaat bil-thulooj.) - The ground is covered with snow.

when_to_say: Used to describe a large natural elevation of the earth's surface.
example: الجبل مرتفع جدًا. (al-jabal murtifa' jiddan.) - The mountain is very high.

when_to_say: Used to describe a low area of land between hills or mountains, often with a stream running through it.
example: الوادي جميل للغاية. (al-wadi jameel lilghaya.) - The valley is very beautiful.
